title: Can we get a button to get rid of this message permanently?
body:
All the other hints and tips have a box that if you tick you never see that message again e.g. "champions have been locked in, you have a few seconds to select a skin" etc but this one requires you to click "close" every single time, and its not like its a frequent message or anything...
i have won 966 games apparently which means i will have probably played 2000+ total since i began which means I've seen this message an average of 6000 times, this means that i do by now comprehend its meaning and i fully understand that if someone does not click 'Accept' in time i do not get put into champ select, i did manage to figure this out on the 1st time it was shown, hence making the other 5999 times fairly redundant, so i really don't need to be shown the same message again and again, i can see if someone doesn't accept because one of the little pictures doesn't light up before the timer ends AND i dont get put into champ select, so can there please be a little tick box introduced to get rid of the message permanently?
it is kinda annoying

thanks ^^

replies.body: Definitely wouldn't mind saying good bye to this annoying notification. +1

uhh, there is....
You go to settings (on LoLclient), there should be a few options to choose from, ignore those!
Go straight to the option that says: 'Suppress notifications'
wont that suppress, post-game honour notifications, receiving gifts/honour badges notifications, game invite notifications etc.

It will yes...
Just check your god damn notifications, i mean you cant be that lazy
Click the settings icon in the client and check the box that says "Suppress Notification Popups"

it goes away by itself. not everyone is looking at the lol client 24/7. im doing other shit in the meantime and occasionally ill look away from computer for whatever reason and look back and im back in lobby or whatever, at least if i have a glance of that message its a quicker reminder that everythings good and das what happened to bring me back there
and thats fair enough, but some of us don't, and for those people would it hurt to have a tick box?
